lead_paragraph: The 35-year-old Moroccan, concerned about foul play by the man’s family, hoped to have the sample analyzed by European doctors, according to her representative.

headline.main: Woman Who Took Husband’s Intestine on Flight Wanted It Tested, Lawyer Says

snippet: The 35-year-old Moroccan, concerned about foul play by the man’s family, hoped to have the sample analyzed by European doctors, according to her representative....
abstract: Intestine discovered in checked luggage on flight to Austria raises eyebrows; lawyer for Moroccan woman who was carrying it says she took piece of dead husband's intestine on flight because she was concerned he had been poisoned and wanted European doctors to examine it.
